subject: Languages
title: The Milan Conference: A Catastrophe for Sign
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Milan Conference: A Catastrophe for Sign.

hook.text: In 1880, a conference of hearing educators voted to ban sign language from deaf schools worldwide.

buildup.text: The International Congress of Educators of the Deaf met in Milan, Italy.

discovery.text: They declared that oral methods (lip reading and speech) were superior to sign language.

twist.text: Only one delegate out of 164 was deaf. Deaf people were excluded from the decision about their own language.

climax.text: The ban lasted nearly a century. Deaf children were punished for signing in schools across Europe and America.

punchline.text: Hearing people decided deaf people didn't need sign language. It took 100 years to undo.

quiz.question: What did the 1880 Milan Conference decide?
options: To ban sign language from deaf schools
